ECClass.description: A slopping element that transistions between two elevations

ECProperty.description: The 'high' point of the element-aligned bounding box of the Element.
The 'low' point of the element-aligned bounding box of the Element.
The Spatial Category used to categorize the 3D Geometric Element
Code is the formal name (business key) for an element. The combination of Code Specification, Code Scope, and the Code value must be unique.
Code Scope identifies the element/name that provides the uniqueness scope for the code value. The combination of Code Specification, Code Scope, and the Code value must be unique.
The Code Specification used to generate and validate the code for the element. The combination of Code Specification, Code Scope, and the Code value must be unique.
The GUID used to federate this element across repositories.
Binary stream used to persist the geometry of this Element.
If true, this element will have an entry in the Spatial Index.
A string property that users and/or applications can use to persist JSON values.
The last modified time of the element. This is maintained by the core framework and should not be set directly by applications.
The Model that contains this element.
The placement origin of the Element.
The parent element that owns this element.
The Pitch angle (in degrees) of the orientation of the Element.
The Roll angle (in degrees) of the orientation of the Element.
(From IFC) Enumeration : IfcRoofTypeEnum
An optional name given by the user (as opposed to the formal name stored in the Code value).
The Yaw angle (in degrees) of the orientation of the Element.
(From IFC) Enumeration : IfcRoofTypeEnum
